headline: Trump could flip ‘kill switch’ on payments in the West
summary: Western countries fear that Donald Trump could flip a “kill switch” to disrupt payment systems as a means of pressuring allies, a former Bank of England top official has warned.

headline: Ex-BoE deputy governor warns Trump could flick financial payments 'kill switch'
summary: LONDON (Reuters) -Countries that see themselves as U.S. allies are now considering whether President Donald Trump's administration could one day disrupt their payments systems to exert diplomatic pressure, a former top Bank of England official has said.  Jon Cunliffe, the BoE's deputy governor for financial stability from 2014 to 2024, said Western countries relied heavily on U.S.-headquartered Visa and Mastercard for day-to-day domestic transactions and found it hard to avoid U.S. banks when making foreign payments.

raw.headline: Ex-BoE deputy governor warns Trump could flick financial payments 'kill switch'
raw.summary: LONDON (Reuters) -Countries that see themselves as U.S. allies are now considering whether President Donald Trump's administration could one day disrupt their payments systems to exert diplomatic pressure, a former top Bank of England official has said.  Jon Cunliffe, the BoE's deputy governor for financial stability from 2014 to 2024, said Western countries relied heavily on U.S.-headquartered Visa and Mastercard for day-to-day domestic transactions and found it hard to avoid U.S. banks when making foreign payments.
